How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List: It has been fantastic to be involved with GHJP over the past year and a half - I have not found this level of critical analysis and practice-based work happening anywhere else at YSPH.

Ali has been a supportive advisor, has pushed me to think critically about my work, and has encouraged me to create work even when it is imperfect. I appreciated her leadership and her willingness to let students work independently, and to take direction from community partners.
I worked primarily with Ali Miller.
I worked primarily with Ali Miller.

I would recommend this course to any public health student who is willing to think critically about the role of public health in enforcing or disrupting systemic oppression. It has been one of the most valuable experiences I have had at YSPH.
